intro: Tridax trifida var. alboradiata, commonly known as white-rayed tridax, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its stems are slender and often branched, with a tendency to sprawl along the ground. The species is known for its rapid growth and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
